substitution.copyText: Ham. How now, a Rat dead for a Ducket, dead.
substitution.amendedText: Ham. How, how, a Rat? dead for a Ducket, dead.

substitution.copyText: Ham. Nay I know not, is it the King?
substitution.amendedText: Ham. Nay I know not: is it the King?

substitution.copyText: Ham. A bloody deed, almost as bad good mother | As kill a King, and marry with his brother.
substitution.amendedText: Ham. A bloody deed; almost as bad, good mother, | As kill a King, and marry with his brother.

substitution.copyText: Ham. I Lady, it was my word. | Thou wretched, rash, intruding fool, farewel, | I took thee for thy better, take thy fortune, | Thou findest to be too busy is some danger. | Leave wringing of your hands, peace, sit you down, | And let me wring your heart, for so I shall | If it be made of penetrable stuff, | " If damned custom have not braz'd it so | " That it be proof and bulwark against sense.
substitution.amendedText: Ham. I Lady, it was my word. | Thou wretched, rash, intruding fool, farewel, | I took thee for thy betters, take thy fortune; | Thou find'st to be too busy, is some danger. | Leave wringing of your hands; peace, sit you down, | And let me wring your heart; for so I shall, | If it be made of penetrable stuff.

substitution.copyText: Ham. Such an act | That blurs the grace and blush of modesty, | Calls vertue hypocrite, takes off the Rose | From the fair forehead of an innocent love, | And sets a blister there, makes marriage vows | As false as Dicers oaths: oh such a deed | As from the body of contraction plucks | The very soul, and sweet Religion makes | A rapsody of words, " heavens face does glow | " Yea this solidity and compound mass | " With heated visage as against the doom, | " Is thought-sick at the act. | Ah me that act.

substitution.copyText: Ham. That roars so loud, and thunders in the Index: | Look here upon this picture, and on this, | The counterfeit presentment of two brothers: | See what a grace was seated on this brow, | Hiperions curls, the front of Jove himself, | An eye like Mars to threaten and command, | " A station like the Herald Mercury | " New lighted on a heaven-kissing hill, | A combination and form indeed | Where every god did seem to set his seal,
